docs.abstract: Tara Siegel Bernard, a personal finance reporter, recommends apps for budgeting, investments and helping little ones as young as 6 understand the value of money.
docs.snippet: Tara Siegel Bernard, a personal finance reporter, recommends apps for budgeting, investments and helping little ones as young as 6 understand the value of money.
docs.lead_paragraph: How do New York Times journalists use technology in their jobs and in their personal lives? Tara Siegel Bernard, a personal finance reporter, discussed the tech she’s using.

headline.main: Spending Is as Easy as Pushing a Button. The Hard Part? Keeping Track.
headline.print_headline: Spending Is Easy. The Hard Part? Keeping Track.

docs.abstract: Thomas Fuller, San Francisco bureau chief, knows you cannot rely on cell networks during earthquakes, wildfires and other breaking news catastrophes.
docs.snippet: Thomas Fuller, San Francisco bureau chief, knows you cannot rely on cell networks during earthquakes, wildfires and other breaking news catastrophes.
docs.lead_paragraph: How do New York Times journalists use technology in their jobs and in their personal lives? Thomas Fuller, a national correspondent based in San Francisco, discussed the tech he’s using.

headline.main: The Must-Have When Reporting on Disasters: A Satellite Phone
headline.print_headline: Equipped for the Big One, With a Satellite Phone

docs.abstract: The California utility’s bankruptcy filing sets up a complicated legal case that could raise electricity rates and hurt power suppliers while generating hundreds of millions in lawyers’ fees.
docs.snippet: The California utility’s bankruptcy filing sets up a complicated legal case that could raise electricity rates and hurt power suppliers while generating hundreds of millions in lawyers’ fees.

headline.main: Who Wins and Who Loses From PG&E’s Bankruptcy
headline.print_headline: Winners, and Losers, in PG&E’s Filing

docs.abstract: The interest rate increase has consequences for savers and spenders alike. Whether you’ve got a savings account or a credit card (or both), here’s what you need to know.
docs.snippet: The interest rate increase has consequences for savers and spenders alike. Whether you’ve got a savings account or a credit card (or both), here’s what you need to know.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve has raised its benchmark interest rate again — Wednesday’s increase was the fourth this year — and consumers can expect to feel it, one way or another.

headline.main: The Fed Just Raised Interest Rates. Here’s What That Means for Your Wallet.
headline.print_headline: Here Are What the Consequences Might Be for Your Wallet

docs.abstract: G.E. made no forecast for what its profits and revenue would look like this year, and its C.E.O. said 2019 was “still very much a work in progress.”
docs.snippet: G.E. made no forecast for what its profits and revenue would look like this year, and its C.E.O. said 2019 was “still very much a work in progress.”
docs.lead_paragraph: H. Lawrence Culp Jr., General Electric’s new chief executive, faces two major tasks.

headline.main: G.E. Earnings Show Glimmers of a Turnaround, but Big Challenges Still Loom
headline.print_headline: Big Challenges Remain, but G.E. Earnings Offer Glimmer of Hope

docs.abstract: A new five-year policy offers $100 billion for infrastructure to stimulate growth — a shift from a focus on consumer spending.
docs.snippet: A new five-year policy offers $100 billion for infrastructure to stimulate growth — a shift from a focus on consumer spending.
docs.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — Russia has become a world-class saver. So much gold has piled up in its central bank that Russia surpassed China last year to become the world’s fifth-largest holder of gold.

headline.main: With Savings to Burn, Russia Turns (Again) to a State-Led Spending Plan
headline.print_headline: Russia, Flush With Cash, Opens Vault  For Stimulus

docs.abstract: The California utility told state regulators that it could spend as much as $2.3 billion to reduce the risk from its equipment this year.
docs.snippet: The California utility told state regulators that it could spend as much as $2.3 billion to reduce the risk from its equipment this year.
docs.lead_paragraph: Pacific Gas and Electric, the troubled California utility, said on Wednesday that it would cut off power during dry and windy weather more frequently, trim more trees along its power lines and spend as much as $2.3 billion to reduce the risk of wildfires.

headline.main: PG&E’s Wildfire Plan Includes More Blackouts, More Tree Trimming and Higher Rates
headline.print_headline: PG&E’s Wildfire Plan: Cut Power and Raise Rates

docs.abstract: The threat of legal action by the Chinese tech giant is part of a broader effort to defend itself from charges that it poses a security risk.
docs.snippet: The threat of legal action by the Chinese tech giant is part of a broader effort to defend itself from charges that it poses a security risk.
docs.lead_paragraph: PRAGUE — In an attempt to push back against attempts to limit its reach in Europe, the Chinese technology giant Huawei threatened legal action against the Czech Republic if its cybersecurity agency did not rescind its warning about the risk the company poses to the nation’s critical infrastructure.

headline.main: Huawei Threatens Lawsuit Against Czech Republic After Security Warning
headline.print_headline: Huawei Threatens the Czech Republic Over Security Warning

docs.abstract: The two companies wanted to merge their rail units to fend off Chinese competition. But Europe’s antitrust enforcer said those fears were overblown.
docs.snippet: The two companies wanted to merge their rail units to fend off Chinese competition. But Europe’s antitrust enforcer said those fears were overblown.
docs.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — European antitrust authorities on Wednesday blocked a plan by Alstom of France and Siemens of Germany to combine their train-making units, killing a deal the companies said they needed to combat increasing competition from China.

headline.main: E.U. Blocks Siemens-Alstom Plan to Create European Train Giant
headline.print_headline: E.U. Kills Train Merger, Rejecting China Threat

docs.abstract: The company has given Alfonso Cuarón’s film a significant theatrical release, but the industry has its doubts about the streaming service’s intentions.
docs.snippet: The company has given Alfonso Cuarón’s film a significant theatrical release, but the industry has its doubts about the streaming service’s intentions.
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — For weeks, “Roma,” the Netflix movie directed by Alfonso Cuarón, has occupied an odd position in Hollywood: both omnipresent and mysterious.

headline.main: Just Who Has Seen ‘Roma’? Netflix Offers Clues
headline.print_headline: Who Has Seen ‘Roma’? Netflix Offers Clues
